intro: Chrysosplenium guangxiensis, commonly known as Guangxi chrysosplenium, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous regions and forest understories. It has limited distribution and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations. Its conservation status is a concern due to habitat loss and limited genetic diversity.
